Cologne, Germany‚Äôs fourth-largest city with a population of more than 1m, is known in the festive season for its Christmas markets, but it is a year-round hub for media and research.‚Å†
‚Å†
‚úÖPolitical partying‚Å†
Cologne hosts Germany‚Äôs ‚Äî and one of the world‚Äôs ‚Äî largest pride parades. Historically, the event has always had a political focus, and this year‚Äôs marked the 50th anniversary of the Stonewall riots in New York, attracting more than 1m visitors to the city centre.‚Å†
‚Å†
‚úÖMedia hub‚Å†
Some 57,000 people work in the city‚Äôs thriving media and creative industries, with Cologne‚Äôs chamber of commerce listing more than 23,500 member companies in these sectors. Cologne is also is a national centre for TV production, producing more than a third of the country‚Äôs programmes.‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more.‚Å†
‚Å†
üì∏: Marcel Kusch/DPA/AFP/Getty‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #holiday #tourism #travel #architecture #architect #design #luxury‚Å†

When do you know if a colleague or acquaintance is something more?‚Å†
‚Å†
Friends are intrinsic to the school and university experience. But no one goes to work to make friends ‚Äì though, if you‚Äôre lucky, you make them anyway.‚Å†
‚Å†
Kate Leaver, author of The Friendship Cure, says the most common question she is asked is how to make friends as an adult. "So many of our earliest friendships are shaped by convenience and proximity," she tells the FT's Emma Jacobs. "At school, it can be as much to do with who you‚Äôre sat next to alphabetically as with how much you have in common."‚Å†
‚Å†
As adults though we meet new friends by talking to neighbours, finding people on social media, joining sports and book groups. "There is no template, though, and no easy way to tackle the awkwardness of asking a colleague out for a drink or the panic of disclosing too much via a risqu√© joke," writes Emma.‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more.‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #work #workplace #quotes #friends #friendship #motivation #love #success #instagood #lifestyle #happy #quote

Why do humans drink alcohol? To the person waiting at the bar on a hot summer evening, the answer seems simple: drinking is a pleasure and a relief. To the public health official reading reports of alcohol‚Äôs societal ruin, the answer might seem frustrating. Why would anyone drink, if it‚Äôs so bad for you?‚Å†
‚Å†
To Robin Dunbar, and his fellow evolutionary psychologists, the answer has emerged in a different and fascinating light, thanks to some intriguing research. It is both simple and complex at the same time. ‚Å†
‚Å†
‚ÄòLike all monkeys and apes, humans are intensely social. We have an urgent desire to schmooze and an awareness that alcohol helps our cause,' writes Mr Dunbar. 'Friendships protect us against outside threats and internal stresses, and this has been key to our evolutionary success. Primate social groups, unlike most other animals, rely on bondedness to maintain social coherence. And for humans, this is where a shared bottle of red wine plays a powerful role.'‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more.‚Å†
‚Å†
üì∏: Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #alcohol #drink #society ‚Å†
 #drinks #cocktails #bar #booze #cheers  #xmas #love #holidays #holiday #gift #winter #instagood #christmastime

Would you like a luxury shed? .

The desire for ‚Äúsecret space‚Äù ‚Äî in the form of a bespoke, contemporary and spacious garden shed ‚Äî is driving an entire architectural trend. ‚ÄúThe sense of separation is really important,‚Äù says Jonathan Silver, an architect whose Pavilion, an ‚Äúundeniably modern‚Äù shed structure, sits in the garden of his own west London flat. ‚ÄúYou really get away; you can shut the door.‚Äù
.

Today‚Äôs luxury sheds are a hideaway from noisy family life ‚Äî a place for adults to indulge their creative urges and pet projects in peace. They are also ideal projects for young architectural practices to showcase innovation and style. David Cameron, the former UK prime minister, may have opted for an off-the-shelf shepherd‚Äôs hut structure in which to write his memoirs but there are many more imaginative options.

Tap the link in our bio to read more. üì∏: Wai Ming Ng

#FT #financialtimes #architecture #design #shed #luxury #design

What makes a good boss?‚Å†
‚Å†
Employees have higher job satisfaction and are less likely to leave when they think their boss is an expert in the business area ‚Äî and could do their own job if necessary. While qualities such as emotional intelligence and charisma can be important, it is this sort of ‚Äúexpert‚Äù boss who often makes employees happy. It is something for organisations to think about when they recruit leaders: expertise and knowledge of a sector count for a lot more than has been acknowledged in the past.‚Å†
‚Å†
So, if good bosses are more common than bad, why do we hear so much about bad ones? Might it be that, as in a football match, we only talk about referees when they make a bad decision or if we don‚Äôt like the decisions they make?‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more.‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #work #workplace #quotes ‚Å†
 #motivation #business #entrepreneur #success #instagood #grind #quote

Where are the best places for power dining in London? ‚Å†
‚Å†
The misconception abides that to open a restaurant in London‚Äôs most expensive boroughs requires a chef who measures success in Michelin stars, and a room that looks like the inside of a jewellery box and sounds like an Ibiza rooftop bar.‚Å†
‚Å†
Mayfair, the traditional heartland of London hedge funds and their investor base, in particular defaults to this kind of unnecessary excess. Visitors to the area can expect multi-course menus veneered with signal ingredients such as truffle and foie gras. They‚Äôre ostentatiously expensive yet, after opening week, rarely run at more than half capacity.‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more.‚Å†
‚Å†
üì∏: Dan Kitwood/Getty Images‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #ftglobetrotter #food  #foodie #foodporn #instafood #foodstagram #dinner #lunch #eat  #photooftheday #photographer #art #travel #picoftheday #photo

At ¬£42,000, the Mandarin Oriental‚Äôs penthouse is London‚Äôs most expensive hotel suite ‚Äî but is it worth it?‚Å†
‚Å†
To find out the answer, click the link in our bio to read Long Story Short ‚Äì our newsletter with a selection of the FT‚Äôs biggest and best stories, handpicked by one of our journalists each week. ‚Å†
‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #property #luxury #design #wealth ‚Å†#realestate #properties #investment #interiordesign #architecture #luxuryrealestate #style #art #fashion #interior #decor

Denise Coates, who founded the online betting group Bet365 with her brother John in a Portakabin in Stoke-on-Trent almost 20 years ago, received a base salary of ¬£277 million last year, 26% more than a year earlier, according to regulatory filings.‚Å†
‚Å†
She was also awarded a 50% share of a ¬£92.5m dividend, bringing her total package to ¬£323 million and cementing her position as one of the world‚Äôs highest-paid executives. According to the Forbes list of billionaires, Ms Coates has a net worth of $12.2 billion.‚Å†
‚Å†
Ms Coates‚Äôs bumper pay is more than 60 times the ¬£4.7 million mean annual pay package of a FTSE 100 chief executive in 2018. The highest-paid boss of a UK-listed company was Jeff Fairburn of Persimmon, who received ¬£38.9 million last year, according to a report published in August by the High Pay Centre think-tank.‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more. ‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #FinancialTimes #Bet365 #betting #salary ‚Å†

Donald Trump became the third president in US history to be impeached when the House of Representatives charged him with using the power of his office for personal gain in a partisan vote that could be the defining moment of his presidency. 
The vote on Wednesday night paves the way for a January trial in the Senate, where Republican control makes it unlikely that Trump will be removed from office ‚Äî or that the tribal divisions afflicting American society will soon heal.

Tap the link in bio to read more.

#FT #FinancialTimes #USPolitics #DonaldTrump

Days of demonstrations across India have seen thousands of people converge on campuses and in the streets to protest. At least six people have been killed as protesters have clashed with police and hundreds have been arrested, while authorities have imposed internet blackouts to maintain order.‚Å†
‚Å†
In New Delhi, police fired tear gas at protesters throwing stones on Tuesday. The government has faced an eruption of anger in the capital since police stormed Jamia Millia Islamia university on Sunday, beating and allegedly shooting demonstrators with live bullets. ‚Å†
‚Å†
The backlash against the law, an important element of Mr Modi‚Äôs goal to redefine India as a Hindu homeland, has escalated since the bill was passed by parliament last week. It offers Hindus and other non-Muslim migrants from Muslim-majority neighbours Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan fast-tracked citizenship, which critics say undermines India‚Äôs secular foundations.‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more. ‚Å† üì∏: Dibyangshu Sarkar/AFP/Getty
‚Å†
#FT #finanicaltimes #India #asia #protest #city #march #protests #protesters #law #political #politics #newdelhi ‚Å†

The African grey parrot is not entirely grey. The medium-sized bird, which lives in forests in west and central Africa, has electric-red tail feathers that make it a target for poachers, who use the plumage for ceremonial headdresses. Its body parts are used in traditional medicine. But that is the least of its problems; it has also been a sought-after pet since biblical times.‚Å†
‚Å†
In an era when the international pet trade has reached industrial proportions, the demand threatens the African grey‚Äôs long-term existence in the wild. It inhabits a strip of equatorial forest that runs from Ivory Coast through Nigeria, Cameroon and Gabon and into the Democratic Republic of Congo. In Ghana, where poaching has been intense, the population has fallen more than 90% since the early 1990s, according to estimates.‚Å†
‚Å†
So acute has the problem become that the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (Cites) outlawed trade of the African grey altogether in 2016. Before the ban, about 1.3m parrots had been exported legally since 1980, according to estimates, excluding the hundreds of thousands that likely died during trapping and transportation.‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more. ‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #FTappeal #FTseasonalappeal #ZSL #wildlife #animal #animals

‚ÄòChristmas decorations are the antidote to the insubstantial digital ether in which we are increasingly absorbed. They reside firmly in the sphere of the physical, in the world of the senses, of touch and of sound, as they jangle together and shine on opening that box‚Äô, says Edwin Heathcote, the FT‚Äôs architecture critic, in a very personal column about his family‚Äôs festive decorations.‚Å†
‚Å†
Heathcote believes that the imperfect scratches, the peeling silvering and the residue of glitter that sticks to our hands are the accumulated memories of childhood. ‚ÄòThe look of Christmas is profoundly personal, and if it is not deeply meaningful, then what is it? Those stray, cheap decorations are among the pieces that hold the most intense memories of my parents, both of whom are now gone‚Äô.‚Å†
‚Å†
For more, click the link in our bio to read Long Story Short, our newsletter with a selection of the FT‚Äôs biggest and best stories, handpicked by one of our journalists each week. ‚Å†
‚Å†
#Holidays #Christmas #decor #FT #financialtimes #family

Boris Johnson has secured a huge victory in the UK election and will return as prime minister.‚Å†
‚Å†
So what happened?‚Å†
The Conservatives won their biggest national majority since 1987, delivering an electoral earthquake that left the opposition parties Labour and the Liberal Democrats seeking new leaders. ‚Å†
‚Å†
What does this mean for Brexit? ‚Å†
Boris Johnson described the result as a ‚Äúpowerful new mandate‚Äù to deliver Brexit. The PM has promised to bring forward his Brexit legislation before Christmas, with a view to Britain leaving the EU on January 31. ‚Å†
‚Å†
What's next?‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to follow all the key updates (note: it‚Äôs free to read)‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #news #politics #britain #uk

The exit poll is predicting a thumping majority for Boris Johnson, and the Conservative party's best performance since under Margaret Thatcher in 1987. It would be Labour's worst performance in terms of seats since 1935.‚Å†
‚Å†
The pound has shot up to its highest level since June 2018 against the dollar following the poll as traders have been reassured by the prospect of a Tory majority. ‚Å†
‚Å†
What do you think about the prediction?‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio for live updates (free to read). ‚Å†
‚Å†
#GeneralElection #GE2019 #GeneralElection2019 #Britain #UK #vote #politics #voting #election #democracy #ukpolitics #electionday

Millions have voted in the UK's third general election in less than five years. ‚Å†
‚Å†
We‚Äôve made our election live updates free to read so everyone ‚Äî not only FT subscribers ‚Äî can keep up with all the news throughout the night. Tap the link in our bio to join us for the ride as Britain decides: ft.com/ukelection‚Å†
‚Å†
#GeneralElection #GE2019 #GeneralElection2019 #Britain #UK  #vote #politics #voting #election #democracy #ukpolitics #electionday

Is this America's most spectacular hotel?

The Sheldon Chalet in Alaska is situated in the vast wilderness of Denali National Park.

From its hexagonal shape, the chalet's guests ‚Äì a maximum of 10 at any time ‚Äì can watch the aurora borealis or survey an endless horizon of jagged peaks blanketed in untouched snow.

Tap the link in our bio to read more. üì∏: Chris Burkard/ Jeff Schutz

#FT #financialtimes #snow #holiday #tourism #travel #architecture #architect #design #luxury

A small group of poachers walks along a dried-up riverbed, hoping to kill a black rhino and remove its horns, which could fetch as much as $100,000 on the Asian black market. ‚Å†
‚Å†
The men are concealed by undergrowth on the riverbanks but seen by a poaching alarm system developed by the Zoological Society of London. Their guns and knives trigger the Instant Detect system‚Äôs hidden metal detector, which activates a camera camouflaged in a bush. The images travel by radio to a base station and then via a communications satellite to the park headquarters, alerting the authorities in time to dispatch rangers and catch the gang.‚Å†
‚Å†
Similar scenarios will soon be playing out in reserves and parks around the globe, as conservation bodies adopt a high-tech approach in their battle to protect animals. ‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more. ‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #FTappeal #FTseasonalappeal #ZSL #wildlife #animal #animals ‚Å†

This is Sanna Marin. This week she will become the world‚Äôs youngest serving prime minister after Finland‚Äôs Social Democrats elected the 34-year-old to head the leftwing coalition government. ‚Å†
‚Å†
Ms Marin, currently the transport minister, will join the other four parties in the coalition, which are all led by women, three of them in their thirties, a record for Finland. ‚Å†
‚Å†
She may not remain the world‚Äôs youngest government leader for long: Sebastian Kurz, who became Austrian chancellor at the age of 31 in 2017, is in talks to form a new government in Vienna. Other heads of state in their thirties include 39-year-old Jacinda Ardern, who became New Zealand prime minister two years ago.‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more. ‚Å†
‚Å†
üì∏: Vesa Moilanen / Lehtikuva / AFP‚Å†
‚Å†
#Finland #politics #pm #politician #leadership #girlboss #ft #newspaper #financialtimes

This year, the FT‚Äôs charity partner for its Seasonal Appeal is the Zoological Society of London. ‚Å†
‚Å†
What is ZSL?‚Å†
The Zoological Society of London is an international charity dedicated to the conservation of animals and their habitats.‚Å†
‚Å†
Where does ZSL work?‚Å†
ZSL is active across the globe, with 259 staff and 434 community members trained in wildlife monitoring techniques across Africa and Asia. ‚Å†
‚Å†
How much impact has ZSL had?‚Å†
Since its inception, ZSL has worked to conserve some of the world‚Äôs most endangered species and improve the public‚Äôs understanding of environmental issues.‚Å†
‚Å†
How can you help? ‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio and help us support ZSL‚Äôs urgent work by making a donation to the FT‚Äôs Seasonal Appeal. ‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #FTappeal #FTseasonalappeal #ZSL #wildlife #animal #animals ‚Å†

This week we published leaked documents obtained by the Financial Times that reveal Chinese technology companies such as ZTE, Dahua and China Telecom are shaping new facial recognition and surveillance standards at the UN.

These standards, which usually take about two years to be drafted and adopted, are highly influential in setting the rules around how tech is developed and used, especially by developing countries in Africa, the Middle East and Asia.

Data from African markets are of particular interest to Chinese companies, who are looking to improve the accuracy of their facial recognition algorithms, particularly to identify people of colour. 
The proposals being discussed at the UN have been criticised by human rights lawyers as crossing the line from technical specifications to policy recommendations, including outlining use cases and data requirements for facial recognition and other surveillance technologies.

For more, click on our link in bio to read Long Story Short, our newsletter with a selection of the FT‚Äôs biggest and best stories, handpicked by one of our journalists each week.

#facialrecognition #privacy #digitalprivacy #FT #financialtimes #China #surveillance

Jo Swinson is the first woman to lead the Lib Dems and the youngest-ever female leader of a British political party. When a journalist asked her during the leadership campaign this summer if she had immediate plans to have another baby, the mother of two was quick to point out that the interviewer would never have asked the question of a male politician.‚Å†
.‚Å†
.‚Å†
She says she‚Äôs constantly asked how she does it with two young sons, whether she misses them while out on the campaign trail, or what her husband thinks of her taking such a leading role in public life. In September 2018, she made history when she was the first MP to bring her baby into a Commons debate.‚Å†
.‚Å†
.‚Å†
Is it ever appropriate to ask a woman in public life to talk about how she ‚Äúdoes it‚Äù? ‚Å†
.‚Å†
.‚Å†
As part of our special Women of the Year series, @jo_swinson talks to us about Brexit, sexism and her attempt to disrupt two-party politics. Tap on the link in our bio to read the interview ‚Äî and discover more from the series #joswinson #libdems #ukelection #financialtimes #ftweekend #ftmag‚Å†

Where are the best places for a power lunch in Mayfair, London?‚Å†
‚Å†
‚ÄòMayfair, the traditional heartland of London hedge funds and their investor base, in particular defaults to a kind of unnecessary excess,‚Äô the FT‚Äôs Bryce Elder writes. ‚ÄòIt has far too many glittering, gloomy, noisy restaurants that could be dropped unaltered into any Las Vegas casino or Dubai exhibition centre.‚Äô ‚Å†
‚Å†
Visitors to the area can expect multi-course menus veneered with signal ingredients such as truffle and foie gras. They‚Äôre ostentatiously expensive yet, after opening week, rarely run at more than half capacity.‚Å† However, there are some hidden gems that make for the perfect business lunch. To find out out more, click on our link in bio to read Long Story Short, our newsletter with a selection of the FT‚Äôs biggest and best stories, handpicked by one of our journalists each week. ‚Å† üì∏: Bentley‚Äôs Oyster Bar & Grill‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #mayfair #london #food #ftglobetrotter #powerlunch

People with disabilities are increasingly entering the UK job market, but the pay gap between them and the rest of the workforce remains large. 
A new study published by the Office for National Statistics shows that 53.2% of people with a physical or mental disability were in employment ‚Äî two percentage points higher than the same period last year, and up from 43.4% in 2013.

Ahead of the international day of disabled persons on December 3, the ONS also compiled the first disability pay gap data, which show a 12.2% difference in pay between those with and without a disability. 
For the full article, click our link in bio.  #UK #jobmarket #employment

Where are the top spots for a business dinner in Frankfurt, Germany? ‚Å†
‚Å†
When it comes to finding a spectacular spot for a celebratory dinner or a power lunch, Germany‚Äôs financial centre struggles to compete with its European rivals. While there are just nine restaurants in Frankfurt with one or more Michelin stars, the equivalent figure for London is 69. For Paris, it is 120.‚Å†
‚Å†
In part that reflects a culture that tends to value shorter working hours and more time spent outside the office, over long, boozy business lunches. However, the city on the River Main is not starved of choice for food and drink ‚Äî it‚Äôs full of stylish places to grab a good cup of coffee or a tasty meal with a colleague or client.‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more.‚Å†
‚Å†
üì∏: Frank Rumpenhorst/DPA/AFP/Getty Images ‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #ftglobetrotter #germany #frankfurt #travel #globetrotter #travelgram #instatravel #adventure #explore #photooftheday #travelphotography #photography #holiday

‚ÄòPresenteeism‚Äô describes a situation when someone is at work but not really all there ‚Äì not 100%, not at their best, feeling a bit unwell or maybe a little distracted.‚Å†
‚Å†
Choosing to go to work when ill is often driven by a fear of being labelled ‚Äúunreliable‚Äù or ‚Äúunable to handle the pressure‚Äù.‚Å†
‚Å†
If employees link being present at work with the prospect of promotion, or the type of work they might be given responsibility for, it can mean those with anxiety or depression are more likely to struggle on the job instead of taking time off, explains Stephen Bevan, head of human resources research development at the UK‚Äôs Institute for Employment Studies.‚Å†
‚Å†
Turning up for work when ill often has a longer-term impact on productivity, because the recovery period is extended ‚Äì and that is not to mention the effect it can have on others. ‚Å†
‚Å†
Tap the link in our bio to read more.‚Å†
‚Å†
#FT #financialtimes #work #workplace #data #presenteeism #motivation #business #inspiration #success #lifestyle #job #quotes‚Å†
